description: A set of universal batteries. Used to charge almost any electronic device.
name: batteries

description: A small quantity of thread that could be used to refill a sewing kit.
name: thread

description: A tough sinew cut from a corpse, usable as thread.
name: sinew

description: Tough thin fibres, taken from a plant. Can be used as thread.
name: plant fibre

description: A roll of incredibly strong tape. Its uses are innumerable.
name: duct tape

description: Plastic jacketed copper cable of the type used in small electronics.
name: copper wire

description: A nuclear-powered battery. Used to charge advanced and rare electronics.
name: plutonium cell

description: A box of nails, mainly useful with a hammer.
name: nails

description: A handful of pebbles, useful as ammunition for slings.
name: pebbles

description: A handful of darts, useful as ammunition for blowguns.
name: darts

description: A box of ball bearings, useful as ammunition for slings.
name: bearings

description: A box of small steel balls. They deal virtually no damage.
name: BB

description: Feathers from a bird. Useful for fletching arrows
name: feather

description: Weak shotgun ammunition. Designed for hunting birds and other small game, its applications in combat are very limited.
name: birdshot

description: A shell filled with iron pellets. Extremely damaging, plus the spread makes it very accurate at short range. Favored by SWAT forces.
name: 00 shot

description: A heavy metal slug used with shotguns to give them the range capabilities of a rifle. Extremely damaging but rather inaccurate. Works best in a shotgun with a rifled barrel.
name: shotgun slug

description: A shotgun slug loaded with concussive explosives. While the slug itself will not do much damage to its target, it will explode on contact.
name: explosive slug

description: A shell filled with tiny steel darts. Extremely damaging, plus the spread makes it very accurate at short range. Slices through most forms of armor with ease.
name: flechette shell

description: One of the smallest calibers available, the .22 Long Rifle cartridge has maintained popularity for nearly two centuries. Its minimal recoil, low cost and low noise are offset by its paltry damage.
name: .22 LR

description: A brass-jacketed .22 calibre round with superior penetration capacity.
name: .22 FMJ

description: Conical Ball .22 is a variety of .22 ammunition with a very small propellant charge, generally with no gunpowder, resulting in a subsonic round. It is nearly silent, but is so weak as to be nearly useless.
name: .22 CB

description: Rat-shot is extremely weak ammunition, designed for killing rats, snakes, or other small vermin while being unable to damage walls. It has an extremely short range and is unable to injure all but the smallest creatures.
name: .22 rat-shot

description: 9 millimeter parabellum is generally regarded as the most popular handgun cartridge, used by the majority of US police forces. It is also a very popular round in sub-machine guns.
name: 9mm

description: Attempts to improve the ballistics of 9mm ammunition lead to high-pressure rounds. Increased velocity results in superior accuracy and damage.
name: 9mm +P

description: A step beyond the high-pressure 9mm +P round, the +P+ has an even higher internal pressure that offers a degree of armor-penetrating ability.
name: 9mm +P+

description: A brass-jacketed 9mm Parabellum round.  This increases penetration slightly at the cost of reduced expansion.
name: 9mm FMJ

description: This small caliber pistol round offers quite good armor penetration at the cost of slightly less damage. It is rarely used outside of the Chinese army.
name: 7.62mm Type P

description: The .38 Smith & Wesson Special enjoyed popularity among US police forces throughout the 20th century. It is most commonly used in revolvers.
name: .38 Special

description: The .38 Super is a high-pressure load of the .38 Special caliber. It is a popular choice in pistol competitions for its high accuracy, while its stopping power keeps it popular for self-defense.
name: .38 Super

description: A brass-jacketed .38 round.  This increases penetration slightly at the cost of reduced expansion.
name: .38 FMJ

description: Originally used by the FBI, the organization eventually abandoned the round due to its high recoil. Although respected for its versatility and power, it has largely been supplanted by the downgraded .40 S&W.
name: 10mm Auto

description: The .40 Smith & Wesson round was developed as an alternative to 10mm Auto for the FBI after they complained of high recoil. It is as accurate as 9mm, but has greater stopping power, leading to widespread use in law enforcement.
name: .40 S&W

description: A brass-jacketed .40 Smith & Wesson round.  This increases penetration slightly at the cost of reduced expansion.
name: .40 FMJ

description: Described (in 1971) by Dirty Harry as "the most powerful handgun in the world," the .44 Magnum gained widespread popularity due to its depictions in the media. In reality, its intense recoil makes it unsuitable in most cases.
name: .44 Magnum

description: A brass-jacketed variant of the .44 Magnum round.  This increases penetration slightly at the cost of reduced expansion.
name: .44 FMJ

description: The .45 round was one of the most popular and powerful handgun rounds through the 20th century. It features very good accuracy and stopping power, but suffers from moderate recoil and poor armor penetration.
name: .45 ACP

description: Full Metal Jacket .45 rounds are designed to overcome the poor armor penetration of the standard ACP round. However, they are less likely to expand upon impact, resulting in reduced damage overall.
name: .45 FMJ

description: The .45 Super round is an updated variant of .45 ACP. It is overloaded, resulting in a great increase in muzzle velocity. This translates to higher accuracy and range, a minor armor piercing capability, and greater recoil.
name: .45 Super

description: The .454 Casull round a very powerful revolver round capable of killing Huge game like Elephants with ease, it's designed to be used with the Taurus Raging Bull.
name: .454 Casull

description: Claimed to be the world's most powerful handgun round, the .500 S&W Magnum was developed in tandem with the revolutionary S&W 500 Revolver.
name: .500 S&W Magnum

description: The 5.7x28mm round is a proprietary round developed by FN Hestal for use in their P90 SMG. While it is a very small round, comparable in power to .22, it features incredible armor-piercing capabilities and very low recoil.
name: 5.7x28mm

description: Designed by Heckler & Koch to compete with the 5.7x28mm round, 4.6x30mm is, like the 5.7, designed to minimize weight and recoil while increasing penetration of body armor. Its low recoil makes it ideal for automatic fire.
name: 4.6x30mm

description: Designed during World War II by the Soviet Union, the popularity of the AK-47 and the SKS contributed to the widespread adoption of the 7.62x39mm rifle round. However, due to its lack of yaw, this round deals less damage than most.
name: 7.62x39mm M43

description: The M67 variant of the popular 7.62x39mm rifle round was designed to improve yaw. This causes the round to tumble inside a target, causing significantly more damage. It is still outdone by shattering rounds.
name: 7.62x39mm M67

description: The .223 rifle round is a civilian variant of the 5.56 NATO round. It is designed to tumble or fragment inside a target, dealing devastating damage. The lower pressure of the .223 compared to the 5.56 results in lower accuracy.
name: .223 Remington

description: This rifle round has enjoyed widespread use in NATO countries, thanks to its very light weight and high damage. It is designed to shatter inside a target, inflicting massive damage.
name: 5.56 NATO

description: A variant of the widely-used 5.56 NATO round, incendiary rounds are designed to burn hotly upon impact, piercing armor and igniting flammable substances.
name: 5.56 incendiary

description: Based off the military .30-03 round, the .270 rifle round is compatible with most guns that fire .30-06 rounds. However, it is designed for hunting, and is less powerful than the military rounds, with nearly no armor penetration.
name: .270 Winchester

description: The .30-06 is a very powerful rifle round designed for long-range use. Its stupendous accuracy and armor piercing capabilities make it one of the most deadly rounds available, offset only by its drastic recoil and noise.
name: .30-06 AP

description: A brass-jacketed variant of the .30-06 round.  Both penetration and stopping power are between the military and other civilian versions of the round.
name: .30-06 FMJ

description: A variant of the powerful .30-06 sniper round, incendiary rounds are designed to burn hotly upon impact, piercing armor and igniting flammable substances.
name: .30-06 incendiary

description: The .308 Winchester is a rifle round, the commercial equivalent of the military 7.62x51mm round. Its high accuracy and phenomenal damage have made it the most popular hunting round in the world.
name: .308 Winchester

description: The 7.62x51mm largely replaced the .30-06 round as the standard military rifle round. It is lighter, but offers similar velocities, resulting in greater accuracy and reduced recoil.
name: 7.62x51mm

description: A variant of the powerful 7.62x51mm round, incendiary rounds are designed to burn hotly upon impact, piercing armor and igniting flammable substances.
name: 7.62x51mm incendiary

description: In the middle of the 21st Century, military powers began to look towards energy based weapons. The result was the standard fusion pack, capable of delivering bolts of superheated gas at near light speed with no recoil.
name: fusion pack

description: A 40mm grenade with a concussive explosion.
name: 40mm concussive

description: A 40mm grenade with a small explosion and a high number of damaging fragments.
name: 40mm frag

description: A 40mm grenade with a small napalm load, designed to create a burst of flame.
name: 40mm incendiary

description: A 40mm grenade with a teargas load. It will burst in a cloud of highly incapacitating gas.
name: 40mm teargas

description: A 40mm grenade with a smoke load. It will burst in a cloud of harmless gas, and will also leave a streak of smoke cover in its wake.
name: 40mm smoke cover

description: A 40mm grenade with a flashbang load. It will detonate with a blast of light and sound, designed to blind, deafen, and disorient anyone nearby.
name: 40mm flashbang

description: A 40mm grenade with an acid bomb load.
name: 40mm acid bomb

description: A 40mm grenade with a buckshot load.
name: 40mm buckshot

description: A 40mm grenade with an armor-piercing flechette load.
name: 40mm flechette

description: A 60mm High Explosive Anti Tank round. They can blow through up to two feet of concrete.
name: 66mm HEAT

description: The Heckler & Koch 12mm projectiles are used in H&K railguns. It's made of a ferromagnetic metal, probably cobalt.
name: H&K 12mm

description: A canister of hydrogen. With proper equipment, it could be heated to plasma.
name: hydrogen

description: A weak plasma charge.
name: charge

description: An empty hull from a shotgun round.
name: shotgun hull

description: An empty casing from a 9mm round.
name: 9mm casing

description: An empty casing from a .22 round.
name: .22 casing

description: An empty casing from a .38 round.
name: .38 casing

description: An empty casing from a .40 round.
name: .40 casing

description: An empty casing from a .44 round.
name: .44 casing

description: An empty casing from a .45 round.
name: .45 casing

description: An empty casing from a .454 Casull round.
name: .454 Casull casing

description: An empty casing from a .500 S&W Magnum round.
name: .500 S&W Magnum casing

description: An empty casing from a 5.7x28mm round.
name: 5.7x28mm casing

description: An empty casing from a 4.6x30mm round.
name: 4.6x30mm casing

description: An empty casing from a 7.62x39mm round.
name: 7.62x39mm casing

description: An empty casing from a .223 round.
name: .223 casing

description: An empty casing from a .30-06 round.
name: .30-06 casing

description: An empty casing from a .308 round.
name: .308 casing

description: A large canister from a spent 40mm grenade.
name: 40mm canister

description: Firearm quality gunpowder.
name: gunpowder

description: Volatile powdered chemical oxidizer.
name: oxidizer powder

description: Powdered caustic soda.
name: lye powder

description: Primer from a shotgun round.
name: shotgun primer

description: Primer from a small caliber pistol round.
name: small pistol primer

description: Primer from a large caliber pistol round.
name: large pistol primer

description: Primer from a small caliber rifle round.
name: small rifle primer

description: Primer from a large caliber rifle round.
name: large rifle primer

description: Assorted bullet materials, useful in constructing a variety of ammunition.
name: lead

description: Small gold bits. Before the cataclysm these would have been worth quite a bit. Still usable in making ammunition.
name: gold

description: Material from an incendiary round, useful in constructing incendiary ammunition.
name: incendiary

description: Gasoline is a highly flammable liquid. When under pressure, it has the potential for violent explosion.
name: gasoline

description: A roll of medical tape, similar to duct tape.
name: medical tape

description: A beanbag round for shotguns, not deadly but designed to disable.
name: shotgun beanbag

description: A 40mm beanbag that deals massive non lethal force.
name: 40mm beanbag

description: 8x40mm caseless rounds. Proprietary ammunition for Rivtech firearms. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
name: 8x40mm caseless

description: Handcrafted, bootleg duplicates of Rivtech 8x40mm caseless rounds. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
name: handmade 8x40mm caseless

description: Handcrafted, bootleg, jacketed soft point duplicates of Rivtech 8x40mm caseless rounds. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
name: handmade 8x40mm caseless JSP

description: 8x40mm caseless rounds, full metal jacket. Military grade ammunition for Rivtech firearms. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
name: 8x40mm FMJ caseless

description: 8x40mm caseless rounds, jacketed hollowpoint. Military grade ammunition for Rivtech firearms. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
name: 8x40mm JHP caseless

description: 8x40mm caseless rounds, incendiary type. Military grade ammunition for Rivtech firearms. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
name: 8x40mm incendiary caseless

description: 8x40mm caseless rounds, saboted high-velocity penetrator type. Advanced military grade, armor-piercing ammunition that fires a single depleted uranium flechette. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
name: 8x40mm HVP

description: A 84x246mm High Explosive anti-personnel round for the Carl Gustav M3 recoilless rifle. Designed to be highly effective against personnel.
name: FFV441B HE rocket

description: A 84x246mm High Explosive Dual Purpose anti-materiel round for the Carl Gustav M3 recoilless rifle. Designed to be highly effective against vehicles and structures.
name: FFV502 HEDP rocket

description: A 84x246mm smoke marker round for the Carl Gustav M3 recoilless rifle. Commonly used for signalling, target designation, and for screening troop movements.
name: FFV469 smoke rocket

description: 93mm single-stage high-explosive ammunition for the RPG-7.
name: PG-7VL rocket

description: 66mm incendiary rockets used in the M202 FLASH rocket launcher. Their warheads are filled with thickened pyrophoric agent which burns at 2200 degrees fahrenheit.
name: M235 TPA rocket

description: Designed to defeat modern body armor, the Rivtech 5x50mm flechette round features a biodegradable sabot and a single, fin-stabilized penetrator.
name: RA110 5x50mm flechette

description: An empty plastic hull from a 5x50mm flechette round.
name: 5x50mm hull

description: Charcoal is a flammable carbon based material obtained by removing water and other volatile constituents from animal and vegetation substances. It is produced by slowly heating wood or other substances in the absence of oxygen.
name: charcoal

description: The .50 BMG is a very powerful rifle round designed for long-range use. Its stupendous accuracy and armor piercing capabilities make it one of the most deadly rounds available, offset only by its drastic recoil and noise.
name: .50 BMG

description: A solid steel copper jacketed variant of the .50 BMG round. Penetration is increased, but damage is reduced.
name: .50 BMG SS

description: A variant of the powerful .50 BMG sniper round, incendiary rounds are designed to burn hotly upon impact, piercing armor and igniting flammable substances.
name: .50 BMG incendiary

description: An empty casing from a .50 BMG round. These are rare, so you might want to hold onto these.
name: .50 BMG casing
